Question: Initially, this person expected to face Rudy Giuliani, the Mayor of New York City, as her Republican opponent in the election.
Hints: This person said she did not want to leave the Senate, but that the new position represented a "difficult and exciting adventure".
After moving to the state of New York, this person was elected as a U.S Senator in 2000.
In 2004 and 2006, this person voted against the Federal Marriage Amendment that sought to prohibit same-sex marriage.
